meanings.definition: Stereoisomers: Molecules with the same molecular formula and connectivity but different spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study stereoisomers to understand how their spatial arrangements affect their properties.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use advanced techniques to distinguish between different stereoisomers in a mixture.
meanings.sent3: At the molecular party, the stereoisomers were dancing in unique spatial patterns.
meanings.sent4: The stereoisomers in the puzzle fit together perfectly, like pieces of a complex 3D jigsaw.
meanings.sent5: In the lab, the students marveled at the intricate structures of the stereoisomers under the microscope.

meanings.definition: Stereoisomers: Isomers that have the same atoms and bonds but differ in the spatial arrangement of atoms.
meanings.sent1: The professor explained how stereoisomers can have identical chemical compositions but distinct structures.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemists often encounter stereoisomers when synthesizing new compounds.
meanings.sent3: The stereoisomers played hide and seek with their identical atoms but unique spatial positions.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the stereoisomers was like a mirror reflection, similar yet reversed.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the beauty of the stereoisomers' different arrangements became clear to the students.
